captions.text:
00:07
COMM: Knight Rider, a classic 1980's TV series

in which David Hasselhoff fought crime with
the help of his talking car.

00:20
COMM: This is the story of one man's ten year

crusade to build his own personal replica
of Michael Knight's iconic vehicle, Kit.

00:36
COMM: He's Scott Bainbridge, and he lives
in Newcastle Upon Tyne in the north of England.

00:42
Scott: Knight Rider's sort of a combination

between technology and a cool car, so when
you put those two together, I just fell in

love with it, with all the cool lights on
the dashboard, the scanner light and the car

they use is a great looking car to begin with,
so it just really won be over.

01:00
COMM: In 2004, Scott bought a wreck Pontiac

Trans Am and after ten years work and an outlay
of £18,000, has transformed it into a stunning
replica of Kit.

01:13
Scott: I wouldn't say there's one specific

thing I like about the car on its own, it's
sort of a combination of everything, I mean

it's black, it's sleek and you've got all
the custom stuff on the inside. Everything
works really well.

01:26
COMM: When Scott began his project 10 years

ago, his Pontiac looked very different from
how it looks today.

01:32
Scott: : I first got the car back in 2004,

and it arrived on a low loader and it was
in a very, very sorry state. So it’s taken

me ten years to get it from what it was originally
to what you see now which is the whole interior

has to be redone, all new dashboard, new carpets,
new wheels, and that’s just to get it to
look like the Knight Rider car.

01:53
Scott: But I’m also restoring a 25 year

old American car, so it’s had welding, new
doors, new wings, new windscreen, paint, everything.
Everything’s been replaced.

02:05
COMM: As well as fitting a 5.7 litre V8 engine,

Scott has also paid special attention to recreating
the technological aspects of the original
TV car.

02:15
Scott: Gadget wise it’s got the full dashboard
with the TVs. Kit can talk to you…

02:30
Scott: Gadgets, planned for the future include

an oil slick, a smoke screen, a grappling
hook but I don’t think it will get as far
as auto cruise unfortunately.

02:40
COMM: Scott now takes his Kitt to Car shows
and Sci Fi events.

02:45
Scott: How do I feel when I’m out driving

it? It’s great, it’s I don’t pretend
to be Michael Knight and I’m fighting crime

or anything like that, its nice to just get
out and hear the noise and what not?

02:57
COMM: And the dramatic looking vehicle always
causes a stir on the roads.

03:01
Woman: It just looks like Knight Rider doesn't

it? Who can't remember Knight Rider? It's
fab! Really good, it looks like the real thing,
I love it.

03:10
Man: Come here son. Wow look at this!

03:13
Man: It's the super car with all the gadgets,

all the toys, absolutely everything. Everything
you could ever want. An ITs dream as well
really.

03:21
COMM: The 30-year-old postman says he has

become used to the amount of attention the
car generates.

03:26
Scott: I get quite a lot of thumbs up and

people flashing lights on their cars and people
taking pictures of me. Yeah it’s usually

positive. I think it brings back a lot of
memories for people when they see Kit cruising
down the road.

03:38
COMM: However, Scott is not finished yet – and

still has several improvements he wants to
make to the car.

03:44
Scott: Is it complete? No. all the dashboard

needs to come back out soon I hope, when I
get my new set of electronics. That will take
a while.

03:53
Scott: There’s other bits on the body work

that need to get sorted out it so it will
probably be getting painted for a third time

and I’ve got new interior panels to put
in as well just going back to the screen accuracy

thing, the plastics are a tan colour but mine
aren’t quite right so I’ve got a new set
which need to go on.

04:11
Scott: Do I have any plans to fit turbo boost?

No in a simple word. It might be fun getting
some air but on the way back down I think

the car would be a write off so we’ll leave
that one off, so we'll leave that off.

title: Real Life Knight Rider: Fan Spends £18,000 Recreating Iconic Car
